extensionDescription.message: Allows you to configure the identity that will be chosen upon composing mail.

CorrectIdentity.accountsDescription.message: For every account you can specify the identity that will be chosen upon composing mail.

CorrectIdentity.additionalHeaderFieldsDe.message: List additional mail headers to be searched for finding an original recipient (To find the identity to be used for the reply).

CorrectIdentity.additionalHeaderFieldsTo.message: Some mail providers use non standard header fields to identify the original recipient of a message before forwarding it to the mailbox. To select the correct "from" mail address for a reply, additional headers could be used (if detection is enabled for the account). Keys are case insensitive and must be separated by new lines. An optional occurence number can be added. E.g. received#3 searches in 3rd "Received:" header. Commonly used headers are: Received, Delivered-To, X-Delivered-to, X-Apparently-To, X-Resolved-to, X-Mail-from. Consult the message source to find out which headers could contain relevant information.

CorrectIdentity.aliasesDescription.message: Specify search terms or domains that, when found in the recipient list, will resolve to this identity. Search terms are tried only if the "Selection" settings above don't yield a result.

CorrectIdentity.aliasesTooltip.message: Search terms are case insensitive and must be separated by new lines. You can specify regular expressions between forward slashes (/…/). Addressbooks and mailinglists can also be used for matches.

CorrectIdentity.detectionDescription.message: For every identity you can specify whether and how it may be detected in a recipient list.

CorrectIdentity.identityDetectable.message: allow this identity to be detected

CorrectIdentity.mechanismDefault.message: use the default identity of the account

CorrectIdentity.replyFromRecipient.message: attempt to find and use an identity that appears in its recipient list

CorrectIdentity.keepRecipientAddress.message: use the found matching address from the recipient list as "from", even if it does not match this identity (e.g. for mail servers with catch-all addresses)

CorrectIdentity.removeSenderFromRecipien.message: remove this identity from the recipient list (while used as "from" identity)

CorrectIdentity.safetyDescription.message: You can protect each identity from sending to certain recipients.

CorrectIdentity.warningAliasesDescriptio.message: You will be warned prior to sending to recipients whose names and/or addresses match one of the following search terms.

CorrectIdentity.warningAliasesTooltip.message: Search terms are case insensitive and must be separated by new lines. You can specify regular expressions between forward slashes (/…/). Addressbooks and mailinglists can also be used for matches.

warning.message:
WARNING: You are about to use identity $P1$ to send a message to:
$P2$

Continue?
